Linearity problem for non-abelian tensor products

Valeriy G. Bardakov ,Â  Andrei V. Lavrenov Â andÂ  Mikhail V. Neshchadim Sobolev Institute of Mathematics, Novosibirsk 630090, Russia, Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk 630090, Russia, Novosibirsk State Agrarian University, Dobrolyubova street, 160, Novosibirsk, 630039, Russia, bardakov@math.nsc.ru Saint-Petersburg State University, University Embankment, 7â€“9, Saint-Petersburg, 199034, Russia, A.V.Lavrenov@gmail.com Sobolev Institute of Mathematics and Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk 630090, Russia, neshch@math.nsc.ru
Abstract.

In this paper we give an example of a linear group such that its tensor square is not linear. Also, we formulate some sufficient conditions for the linearity of non-abelian tensor products GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H and tensor squares GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G. Using these results we prove that tensor squares of some groups with one relation and some knot groups are linear. We prove that the Peiffer square of a finitely generated linear group is linear. At the end we construct faithful linear representations for the non-abelian tensor square of a free group and free nilpotent group.

Key words and phrases:
non-abelian tensor product; linear group; faithful linear representation
2010 Mathematics Subject Classification:
Primary 20E25; Secondary 20G20, 20E05

Also, the non-abelian tensor product is used to describe the third relative homotopy group of a triad as a non-abelian tensor product of the second homotopy groups of appropriate subspaces. The investigation of the non-abelian tensor product from a group theoretical point of view started with a paper by Brown, Johnson, and Robertson [15]. They compute the non-abelian tensor square of all non-abelian groups of order up to 30 using Tietze transformations.

One of the topics of research on the non-abelian tensor products has been to determine which group properties are preserved by non-abelian tensor products. By using homological arguments, Ellis [10] showed that if GğºG and Hğ»H are finite groups, then GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H is also finite. Visscher [12] proved that if GğºG, Hğ»H are solvable (nilpotent), then GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H is solvable (nilpotent) and gives a bound on the nilpotency class of GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H. In [17] it was proved that the tensor product of groups of nilpotency class at most nğ‘›n is a group of nilpotency class at most nğ‘›n, thereby improving the bound given by Visscher. For other results in this direction see the survey of Nakaoka [13].

In this paper we study the linearity problem for non-abelian tensor products. Let nğ‘›n be a positive integer and let Pğ‘ƒP be a field. A group GğºG is said to be linear of degree nğ‘›n over Pğ‘ƒP if it is isomorphic with a subgroup of Gâ€‹Lnâ€‹(P)ğºsubscriptğ¿ğ‘›ğ‘ƒGL_{n}(P), the group of all nÃ—nğ‘›ğ‘›n\times n non-singular matrices over Pğ‘ƒP or, equivalently, if it is isomorphic with a group of invertible linear transformations of a vector space of dimension nğ‘›n over Pğ‘ƒP (see [19]). We study the following

Question 1.

Let GğºG and Hğ»H be linear groups. Are the groups GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H, GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G linear?

We show that in general the answer is negative. More accurately, we prove that the tensor square Sâ€‹Lnâ€‹(â„š)âŠ—Sâ€‹Lnâ€‹(â„š)tensor-productğ‘†subscriptğ¿ğ‘›â„šğ‘†subscriptğ¿ğ‘›â„šSL_{n}(\mathbb{Q})\otimes SL_{n}(\mathbb{Q}) of the special linear group Sâ€‹Lnâ€‹(â„š)ğ‘†subscriptğ¿ğ‘›â„šSL_{n}(\mathbb{Q}) over the field of rational numbers is not linear for nâ‰¥3ğ‘›3n\geq 3. On the other side we formulate some sufficient conditions under which the groups GâŠ—Htensor-productğºğ»G\otimes H, GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G are linear. Using these conditions, we prove that the non-abelian tensor squares of some groups with one defining relation and groups of fibered knots are linear. If GğºG is a finitely generated free group or finitely generated free nilpotent group, then we construct concrete faithful linear representations for GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G.

The non-abelian tensor square GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G is connected to other group constructions: exterior tensor square Gâˆ§GğºğºG\wedge G and Peiffert square Gâ‹ˆGâ‹ˆğºğºG\bowtie G. We prove that if GğºG is finitely generated, then Gâ‹ˆGâ‹ˆğºğºG\bowtie G is linear.

We note that the following problems are still open.

Problem 1.

1) Let GğºG be a finitely generated linear group. Is the group GâŠ—Gtensor-productğºğºG\otimes G linear?

2) Let GğºG be a linear group. Is the group Gâ‹ˆGâ‹ˆğºğºG\bowtie G linear?

3. Linearity problem

In this section we will use a result of Malcev [19] (see also [20, Chapter 2]) on the linearity of abelian groups. To formulate it recall some definitions. If GğºG is any group Ï„â€‹(G)ğœğº\tau(G) is the subgroup of GğºG generated by all the periodic normal subgroups of GğºG; that is Ï„â€‹(G)ğœğº\tau(G) is the maximum periodic normal subgroup of GğºG. GğºG has finite rank at most nğ‘›n if every finite subset of GğºG is contained in an nğ‘›n-generator subgroup of GğºG. If GğºG is abelian and periodic then GğºG has finite rank at most nğ‘›n if and only if for each prime pğ‘p the Sylow pğ‘p-subgroup of GğºG is a direct product of at most nğ‘›n cyclic and PrÃ¼fer pğ‘p-groups (a PrÃ¼fer pğ‘p-group is a â„‚pâˆsubscriptâ„‚superscriptğ‘\mathbb{C}_{p^{\infty}}-group). If Ï€ğœ‹\pi is any set of primes and GğºG is a group with a unique maximal Ï€ğœ‹\pi-subgroup we denote this maximal Ï€ğœ‹\pi-subgroup by GÏ€subscriptğºğœ‹G_{\pi}.

Malcev proved:

i) An abelian group Ağ´A has a faithful representation of degree nâ‰¥1ğ‘›1n\geq 1 over some field of characteristic zero if and only if Ï„â€‹(G)ğœğº\tau(G) has rank at most nğ‘›n.

ii) An abelian group Ağ´A has a faithful representation of degree nâ‰¥1ğ‘›1n\geq 1 over some field of characteristic p>0ğ‘0p>0 if and only if Ï„â€‹(G)pâ€²ğœsubscriptğºsuperscriptğ‘â€²\tau(G)_{p^{\prime}} (here pâ€²superscriptğ‘â€²p^{\prime} denotes all primes except pğ‘p) has finite rank rğ‘Ÿr and Ï„â€‹(A)pğœsubscriptğ´ğ‘\tau(A)_{p} has finite exponent pesuperscriptğ‘ğ‘’p^{e} satisfying

peâˆ’1+maxâ¡{1,r}<n+1.superscriptğ‘ğ‘’11ğ‘Ÿğ‘›1p^{e-1}+\max\{1,r\}<n+1.

There is a linear group GğºG such that GâŠ—G=Gâˆ§Gtensor-productğºğºğºğºG\otimes G=G\wedge G is not linear.
